Package io.crums.sldg

Class PathInfo

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.PathInfo
public class PathInfo
extends java.lang.Object
Structural representation of a path in a ledger.

TODO pseudo-constructor for reverse direction: i.e. given a path's row numbers, construct an equivalent instance with minimum-length declaration.

    Constructors

    PathInfo​(long lo, long hi)
    Constructs a skip path instance.
    PathInfo​(long lo, long target, long hi)
    Constructs a camel path instance.
    PathInfo​(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> declaration)
    Constructs an instance using the given declaring row numbers.

  • Constructor Details

    • PathInfo

      public PathInfo​(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> declaration)
      Constructs an instance using the given declaring row numbers. These are typically a subset of the final row numbers which are composed by stitching in linking row numbers as necessary.
      Parameters:
      declaration - positive, not empty, sorted list of positive row numbers

    • PathInfo

      public PathInfo​(long lo, long hi)
      Constructs a skip path instance.
      Parameters:
      lo - ≥ 1
      hi - > lo

    • PathInfo

      public PathInfo​(long lo, long target, long hi)
      Constructs a camel path instance. A camel path instance is the concatentation of 2 adjacent skip paths meeting at the target row number.
      Parameters:
      lo - ≥ 1
      target - ≥ lo
      hi - > target

  • Method Details

    • rowNumbers

      public final java.util.List<java.lang.Long> rowNumbers()
      Returns the row numbers that structurally define the path. If necessary (usually), this is a stitched version of the declaration.
      Returns:
      lazily loaded, read-only list of linked row numbers

    • declaration

      public final java.util.List<java.lang.Long> declaration()
      Returns the declared row numbers. These are the exactly the numbers specified at construction.
      Returns:
      ordered list of positive longs with no duplicates
      See Also:
      rowNumbers()

    • lo

      public final long lo()
      Returns the lowest row number.

    • isState

      public final boolean isState()
      Determines if this is a state path. By convention, a path that starts at row number 1 is considered a state path from the ledger.
      Returns:
      lo() == 1L

    • hi

      public final long hi()
      Returns the highest row number.

    • equals

      public final boolean equals​(java.lang.Object o)

      Instances are equal if their data are equal.

      Overrides:
      equals in class java.lang.Object

    • hashCode

      public final int hashCode()

      Consistent with equals(Object).

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class java.lang.Object
